p: In the troposphere, observations and both model ALL LEs show global warming over the satellite era ( Fig. 1 B and C ). Human-caused increases in well-mixed GHGs are the main driver of this signal ( 8, 9, 23). Simulated tropospheric warming is generally larger than in satellite data. In TMT, for example, the ensemble trend range is 0.35 °C to −0.43 °C per decade for CanESM2 and 0.20 °C to −0.28 °C per decade for CESM1, while the largest observational trend is −0.20 °C per decade.
